comment:
*

* Represents the list of selected content on a particular page of the PDF document. By * default, the selection boundary is represented from left to right. * Note: Currently supports text selection only.

methods.name: public int getPage()
methods.comment:
* Gets the particular page for which the selection is highlighted.
     *
     * @return The page number on which the current selection resides.

methods.name: public SelectionBoundary getStart()
methods.comment:
*

* Gets the edge from where the selection starts- index is inclusive. * * @return The starting edge of the selection.

methods.name: public SelectionBoundary getStop()
methods.comment:
*

* Gets the edge where the selection stops - index is inclusive. * * @return The stopping edge of the selection.

methods.name: public List<PdfPageTextContent> getSelectedTextContents()
methods.comment:
* Returns the text content within the selection boundaries on the page. In case there are
     * non-continuous selections, this method returns the list of those text content in order of
     * viewing.
     *
     * @return list of text contents within the selection boundaries.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(@androidx.annotation.NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(@androidx.annotation.NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
